intro: Gladiolus mostertiae, commonly known as the Zanzibar gladiolus, is a striking flowering plant native to the island of Zanzibar in Tanzania. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically blooms in the rainy season, producing vibrant pink to purple flowers with a distinctive, recurved shape. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves, and it thrives in well-drained soil with full sun exposure. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
